child_go_fizzbuzz_impl.title: Implement Minimal FizzBuzz in Go
child_go_fizzbuzz_impl.description: Create a minimal Go implementation of FizzBuzz for positive integers. Scope is limited to a single function with clear logic and quick compile-time validation; do not add automated tests.
acceptanceCriteria: A Go source file defines a `FizzBuzz(n int) string` function that returns `FizzBuzz` for multiples of 15, `Fizz` for multiples of 3, `Buzz` for multiples of 5, and the decimal string for all other positive integers.
The implementation uses only the Go standard library and straightforward control flow.
The code compiles successfully with a fast command such as `go build ./...` in the relevant Go module/workspace.
Task output includes brief manual sample checks showing expected results for representative inputs such as 1, 3, 5, and 15.
child_go_fizzbuzz_impl.prompt: Implement Go FizzBuzz in a focused package (for example `go/fizzbuzz/`). Add `fizzbuzz.go` with `FizzBuzz(n int) string`. Do not add test files. Run a quick validation command such as `go build ./...` and include brief manual sample checks for core values.

child_go_fizzbuzz_noop.title: Go FizzBuzz No-Op Child
child_go_fizzbuzz_noop.description: A deliberate no-op child task for the Go FizzBuzz parent. This task exists only to satisfy structure requirements and must not introduce code, configuration, or behavior changes.
acceptanceCriteria: No files are created, modified, moved, or deleted when this task is executed.
No commands that change repository state are required for completion.
Task can be marked complete by recording that no action was needed.
Parent/child linkage remains valid with this task attached to the Go parent.
child_go_fizzbuzz_noop.prompt: Perform no implementation changes. Confirm this is an intentional no-op task and leave the repository unchanged.

child_python_fizzbuzz_impl.title: Implement Minimal FizzBuzz in Python
child_python_fizzbuzz_impl.description: Create a minimal Python implementation of FizzBuzz for positive integers. Scope includes only pure function logic and quick execution/import validation; do not add automated tests.
acceptanceCriteria: A Python module defines `fizzbuzz(n: int) -> str` returning `"FizzBuzz"` for multiples of 15, `"Fizz"` for multiples of 3, `"Buzz"` for multiples of 5, and `str(n)` otherwise for positive integers.
The solution uses simple control flow and no third-party dependencies.
A quick verification command (for example `python -c` import/run) executes successfully in the project environment.
Task output includes brief manual sample checks showing expected results for representative inputs such as 1, 3, 5, and 15.
child_python_fizzbuzz_impl.prompt: Implement Python FizzBuzz in a dedicated path (for example `python/fizzbuzz.py`) with `fizzbuzz(n: int) -> str`. Do not add test files. Run a quick import/run validation command and include brief manual sample checks for core values.

child_python_fizzbuzz_noop.title: Python FizzBuzz No-Op Child
child_python_fizzbuzz_noop.description: A deliberate no-op child task for the Python FizzBuzz parent. This task exists only to satisfy structure requirements and must not introduce code, configuration, or behavior changes.
acceptanceCriteria: No files are created, modified, moved, or deleted when this task is executed.
No commands that change repository state are required for completion.
Task can be marked complete by recording that no action was needed.
Parent/child linkage remains valid with this task attached to the Python parent.
child_python_fizzbuzz_noop.prompt: Perform no implementation changes. Confirm this is an intentional no-op task and leave the repository unchanged.

parent_go_fizzbuzz.title: Go FizzBuzz Minimal Deliverable
parent_go_fizzbuzz.description: Deliver a minimal Go-based FizzBuzz implementation with a fast compile/build verification step. This parent groups lightweight coding and smoke validation into one deliverable.
acceptanceCriteria: The Go child task is completed with a minimal `FizzBuzz` implementation and no automated test files.
All files introduced by the Go child task are in a dedicated Go path and follow idiomatic Go style.
A repeatable quick verification command (for example `go build ./...`) is documented in the child task prompt/output.
No external runtime dependencies are added for the Go solution.
parent_go_fizzbuzz.prompt: Complete the child task to implement minimal Go FizzBuzz quickly, without adding tests, and verify with a fast build/smoke command.

parent_python_fizzbuzz.title: Python FizzBuzz Minimal Deliverable
parent_python_fizzbuzz.description: Deliver a minimal Python-based FizzBuzz implementation with quick runtime/import verification. This parent groups lightweight coding and smoke validation into one deliverable.
acceptanceCriteria: The Python child task is completed with a minimal `fizzbuzz` implementation and no automated test files.
All Python files are organized coherently and are runnable in a standard Python environment.
A repeatable quick verification command (for example a `python -c` import/run check) is documented in the child task prompt/output.
No third-party packages are required for the Python solution.
parent_python_fizzbuzz.prompt: Complete the child task to implement minimal Python FizzBuzz quickly, without adding tests, and verify with a fast runtime/import command.
